tasks.task: Setting up and facilitating discussion groups
subtasks: Identify peers with similar exposure to innovation platforms
Discuss who uses innovation platforms, their functions, and benefits/concerns
Share examples of stakeholders involved (e.g., researchers, farmers, policymakers, private sector)
Explain the typical process of an innovation platform (initiation, focus setting, option identification, solution testing, capacity development, monitoring)
Recognize the importance of full buy-in from all members
Address the need for tangible outputs to sustain stakeholder commitment
Consider monitoring and evaluation difficulties in innovation platforms
Evaluate the most enticing benefits (facilitating dialogue, enabling innovative research)

tasks.task: Comparing innovation platforms to other concepts
subtasks: Recognize similarities between innovation platforms and learning alliances
Differentiate between expected and unexpected outcomes from innovation platforms
Understand why high-tech emphasis may not be necessary in innovation platforms for agriculture
Identify potential positive outcomes (improved relevance, knowledge mobility, enhanced learning)
